date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2020
review_content: Started out strong and interesting and then went downhill from there. Too many unnecessary details and although the story could have ultimately been saved, it totally flopped.  The ending was terrible. Really? That’s the killer? Why? What motive? Felt like author just wanted a twist in the plot and just picked a character out of the story to be the killer.  Terrible! Wasted hours reading this book!
title: Waste of time!

author: Andréa B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2020
review_content: Rice did an amazing job of building her characters, designing the story, giving her readers the twists they desired in just the right places... Before they realized that's what they wanted. Teary-eyed at the end, I've put this book with the elite few stories that will remain with me. Sisters, best friends, lovers, relationships, truth, mystery, honesty, desire, freed, envy, lust... This book had it all.
title: Tragic, twisting, and completely beautiful.

author: D J
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2020
review_content: This story could have been compelling but early in the book the author gave contradictory information about when the victim knew about her husband’s child with his lover. It was distracting and unfortunately put me on the lookout for other discrepancies. I found the characters and the flow more frustrating than entertaining.
title: Disappointing

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2020
review_content: A family owned art gallery hides a lot of family secrets and tragedy. Two sisters shared the loss of their mother with their two best friends from childhood to adult lives .  Confidently tragedy strikes again and not coincidentally the same defective who worked on their mother's case is working on theirs.
title: An artist delight

author: Mema
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2020
review_content: It had my attention at the very beginning. Towards the middle the author got too caught up in the places the characters visited too much unnecessary information. I actually skipped over these pages. When she got to the ending it felt like she ran out of ideas.Didn’t give much of an explanation as to why the murderer did it.She didn’t tie up with what happened to the other characters .I kept turning the pages thinking this is the end ? Very disappointing ! Luanne Rice is better than this book . If this was the first book of hers that I read it would be the last. I’m sorry I wasted a gift card on this book!!!
title: VERY DISAPPOINTING !!!!!!!

author: Diane
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2021
review_content: This book had a good story line BUT—- was much too long with TOO MANY characters, and too many unnecessary side twists that weren’t vital to the story.
title: Too much unnecessary story line!

author: IndyShopper
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2021
review_content: Parts of the story were written very well and held my attention. But, parts were so poorly written, not necessary, or just stupid. It felt like the author tried to check too many boxes to sell books. At the end, I still have many unanswered how and why questions. I don’t understand the 5 star reviews.
title: Just 3 stars from me

author: Jax Hand
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2020
review_content: I picked this novel to read before I knew it takes place where I live and that would have made it special but her characters are clearly drawn for time and situation. The dialogue is real. The crime is unusual and thought provoking. I recommend this highly. I can't wait to read others Rice has written.
title: Like Reading About a Friend

author: Pat Ullmann
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2020
review_content: My first book by Luanne Rice.  Wow what an experience!  Certainly a mystery, suspense filled story from beginning to end.  I kept thinking I knew who the killer was  but not until the last chapter.  Not anyone I expected at all.  Lots of twists and turns.  Highly recommended, will read more of her.
title: Last Day

author: susie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2020
review_content: I liked her characters, but it felt as if the author was making it up as she went along.  The one who did the killing had no motive, really. I wanted to like it. The drops of blood and hearts of blood seemed a little silly. She should have had better feedback and guidance. Her editors let her down.
title: A slow wandering to nowhere

author: Sam Glast
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2020
review_content: Hackneyed cliches with the sole intent to make the reader wonder who killed Beth. Hard to figure out because it appears the sole intent of the author was to plant false clues for confusion’s sake. Four different references to a character needing “to clear their head”. My fault for having read to the end. When killer finally revealed, makes no sense at all. Bad writing.
title: Need to clear my head after reading this book.

author: ZetaZoo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2020
review_content: You think you figured out who did it, then soon plot twists make you think maybe it was another, on to possible accomplices. The end brings you to a surprising conclusion that thinking back on the wonderful storytelling of four forever friends is now obvious and you heard the secrets that they keep. Loved this book and author!
title: Great mystery!

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2020
review_content: Well written & researched, the author takes great pains to give a beautiful sense of place. My favorite parts were the descriptions of locales & areas in the CT town where the book was set. I Found the actionable characters mystifying or annoying. Lulu in party seemed incomplete. Still  good read
title: Engaging

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2020
review_content: This book is sad, raw and relentless. So much like love, between family, sisters and friends. I couldn't let myself see the truth, just as Kate didn't. But when she lets herself love and feel, all of the trauma escalates and dissipates.  Just like love. Look too close and it doesn't seem real. Just feel it, and it grows.
title: Forgiveness

author: Sandra
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020
review_content: This book in many ways was different from her other novels.  Her lovely descriptions were the same but her characters were much more flawed.  I could not wrap my mind around the ending.  It seemed to come out of the blue.  There did not seem to be adequate motive.  In the end I was disappointed.
title: Different from her other novels

author: Myz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2020
review_content: I don’t usually read murder mysteries but I was caught up in this story from the very first pages. Well written. It seemed so obvious in the beginning that I couldn’t imagine several hundred pages more would reveal the killer. But was I ever wrong! So many twists and turns and new possibilities! It was hard to put down and worth the ride!
title: Intriguing

author: Laura L
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2021
review_content: This is the best book I have read in awhile. The characters were well developed and the plot moved along at just the right pace. The complexity of friends, family, and romantic relationships is well balanced. This book covers wrongful relationships and those that never die. Fabulous writing!!
title: Love this

author: Amy S
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2020
review_content: I found this book to be very engaging.  Good characters, excellent plot twists.  I found it a little too easy to identify the killer early on.  Although I wasn't 100% certain, I had a pretty good hunch that turned out to be correct.  I thought the reason for the murder was a little weak.  Still, a very good read.
title: A good read

author: BSKG1943
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2020
review_content: This was a very strange book.  The characters were odd and not very likable.  I think the attempt is to make people think about unbreakable bonds between sisters and friends.  But it came across to me as twisted and creepy.  I chose this rating because it is the lowest allowed.
title: Strange

author: Rafaela Morillas
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2020
review_content: I kept waiting for this book to get better. It never did. You knew within the first 50 pages that her alcoholic friend was involved. Too convoluted, too ridiculous a plot and just plain a waste of time. The cast of characters were not interesting or well developed. Replaying the murder in the basement ad nauseum was exhausting. I would not recommend, particularly to my book club - amateur at best.
title: I kept waiting for this book to get better...

author: Susan W.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2021
review_content: This book surprised me and once hooked I couldn't stop reading and was drawn into the story of Kate and Beth and their family tragedy. Now its twenty three years later and Kate discovers that Beth was murdered.  The solution of the murder mystery surprised me. I hope other readers will be surprised too.
title: Sisters and the best friends who grew up together.

author: Dave Armstrong
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2020
review_content: Slow start, but great finish that will leave you guessing until the end.  Wished the pace at the end carried out through the entire book.  Great characters and story.  While I was reading the book I happened to catch an episode of Forensic Files and had a very similar plot...wife dies, husband out fishing...whodunit?
title: That's what friends are for

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2020
review_content: Just boring.  Took me forever to finish this book. The characters, the murder and the murderer are all so boring and uninteresting.So sick of picking bad reads.  Taking a break from kindle for awhile.
title: Boring . . .

author: lacrossestar
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2020
review_content: It took a while to get connected with this story but once I was hooked, I was invested. That said, I applaud the author’s craft as she wove the mystery without ever giving the ending away. On the other hand I struggled with the motive.  The writing was strong and made this an enjoyable read.
title: This book had highs and lows

author: Tracy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2020
review_content: I downloaded a bunch of Kindle Unlimited books for a trip and this was one. I thought it was an art mystery, but it’s really not. I did stick with it to the end (hence the 2 stars) but some parts—particularly when the dead talk to the living— just made me groan. This happened late in the book so it was not part of the theme, seemed totally out of place. Find something else.
title: Not very good

author: Foxy's Mom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2020
review_content: I think most people who like mysteries would enjoy this book from teens up to adults.  It might have been nice to have Kate become more involved with Connor in fact rather than presumed, but it really doesn't matter to the story.  This book is easily put down & taken back up without getting lost, which is great for busy readers.  As I say, this is a real surprise of an ending!  You won't be sorry you read it.
title: If you like surprise endings......

author: victoria
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2020
review_content: I found this book interesting.  Deals a lot with trauma, obsession and secrets revealed.  Human flaws in even the most perfect person and family. The  murderer reveal seemed a little rushed but the final parting of Kate and Beth was done beautifully.  Not sure why so many poor reviews
title: Friends and secrets

author: One3811
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2020
review_content: This book was readable. It keeps the reader engaged through the intertwined lives of the characters. A whodunit on the Connecticut coastline that is filled with vivid imagery of places, people and art. Just when one thinks there is an answer there is another story to be told that fills in the gaps. Well done.
title: Readable

author: mindy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2020
review_content: Luanne Rice is that rare popular writer who never stumbles over cliche or plot. Each book is truly written; each reader is genuinely moved and filled with deeper knowledge. Yet, each story is one we know—promises made and then broken, carried by larger currents revealed through her characters and her astounding sense of place.
title: Always a Treasure

author: bookworm
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2020
review_content: This is a very good book.  It kept me engrossed from the beginning.  It is about four best friends...two being sisters.  One is murdered and Luanne Rice keeps you guessing from the start who is guilty.  Is it the husband, the lover, a convicted sex predator?  I recommend this novel.
title: Bookworm

author: aaron
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2020
review_content: The book is full of words and sentences that repeat and repeat the same idea to many times and reader is lost on the main idea of th book.
title: A lot of empty words

author: SS@IN
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2020
review_content: Suspense right up to the end. Intriguing because there really wasn't a realistic reason for the crime.  Or for the way it was committed and covered up.  Improbable story, but life is stranger than fiction.  In spite of that, I did enjoy the book and would read more by this author.
title: Mixed feelings

author: KindleReader
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2020
review_content: The mystery behind the murder started out interestingly but suffered under excessive prose throughout the book.  The romance was hinted at off and on but never developed. The reveal at the end was abrupt, not well explained and left the reader feeling like there should be something more compelling to explain such a horrendous killing
title: Engaging start that faded

author: Pamela Jones-Sexton
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2021
review_content: Good mystery of who killed art gallery owner in the seaside town.  Detective Conor Reid is back to help the victim’s sister figure out who killed Beth, 30 years after helping the sisters in a similar situation with their mother.  The unlikely murderer is someone close to the family, although the reason why Is a little weak.
title: Murder mystery in Connecticut art world

author: 1OldGal
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2020
review_content: Sisters endure a horrific experience that changes their lives forever, each in a different way. A tight circle of friends keep each other's secrets, while other feelings quietly simmer beneath the surface. When all is revealed at the end, I felt let down. The motive did not make sense, or even seem plausible to me.
title: Not much suspense, kind of depressing.

author: Chuck in FL
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2020
review_content: I have always been a fan of this author. This is the first  book of hers that I have read in a long time.  It captured me immediately.  I did figure out the killer  pretty early . But I am still perplexed  about why.  Something seemed off near the end.  I still loved the book.
title: Could  Not Put It  Down

author: Gaylak
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2020
review_content: My first Luanne Rice book, but it won't be my last.  Kept me guessing til the end.  Good character development encouraged interest in all major characters.  Interesting description of place and time.  I enjoyed her writing style.  Liked the story and highly recommend the book
title: Great read

author: I.Daily
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2020
review_content: I was interested for probably the first half of the book, but then it got tedious and seemed to go off the rails. What started as a book about art theft and a detective's attempts to solve a murder suddenly shifted to a different book entirely, and one I struggled to finish.
title: Disjointed and dull

author: Pat Hall
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2020
review_content: I am completely enthralled with this book, even more so that it was a First Read choice. If looking for a page turning, who-done-it, till the very end, then Last Day is the book to read. Through sadness and grief, life long wounds are healed, and futures are now a reality, even though the personal cost is almost to overwhelming. Can't wait to read more novels  by Luanne Rice.
title: Greatest First Read Ever

author: J. Mehl
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2020
review_content: Beautiful, rich, successful, surrounded by friends and loved ones, Beth had it all. But her sudden, violent death process that things are not as they seem. Her death impacts her sister, Kate, as it forces her to revisit the kidnapping of the girls and their mother 23 years earlier.
title: Intriguing

author: GirlInGlasses
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2020
review_content: Wow!! This book was so good! I actually wasn’t expecting it to be this good. It sucked me in and totally wrapped me up - I finished it in a day!Normally I’m really good at figuring out mysteries but I didn’t figure it out until the characters did. It was so great to read something and not know how it ends. It was beautiful and emotional and I loved it!
title: SO GOOD

author: Liscelle Aurora Carrillo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2020
review_content: I was enthralled and fully engrossed with this novel. I simply couldn't put it down. I felt only too eager to pick up my kindle and read every chance I got. I highly recommend this book. It is actually my first book from this author I know I will have to pick up another of her novels.
title: Excellent

author: LisaF
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2021
review_content: Yes. Its a murder mystery and an excellent one.  But, the true reason I couldn't put it down was because of the relationships. The author wove a beautiful tapestry of lives and personalities.  I could see them from her words,  feel their emotions...I was captivated. Started the book at noon and didn't stop till I finished.  Great read!!!
title: Poignant

author: Sheila Huntington
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2020
review_content: The author does a really good job of showing the relationships between the characters in the novel. There are a lot of twists and turns in the plot, but the author does a really good job of tying all the loose ends together. I give it five stars. SHEILA HUNTINGTON, AUTHOR
title: VERY GOOD STORY.

author: K. Allison
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2021
review_content: When I first started reading this book, I really liked it. But it did drag on making everyone in the book seem like a suspect. I believe it could have been a much better book if it was at least 25% shorter. And the revelation of who the murderer was at the end did not seem probable to me. It started out good but I was disappointed in the end. Kate, the main character was about the only person I really liked in this book.
title: Didn’t hate the book, it was just slow

author: Lulu
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2020
review_content: I enjoyed this story even though it dealt with an untimely death under gruesome circumstances, grief, family dynamics, infidelity  and friendships. Could hardly put it down till I found out who did it! No spoilers, but I was surprised!Luanne Rice once again held her claim as one of my favorite authors!
title: Do we really ever know people as intimately as we think ?

author: rita jones
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2020
review_content: Kate, the oldest sister has always felt a responsibility to her younger sister Beth. They were victims of the unthinkable. Each lived life differently because of the trauma. This story paints a picture of Love between sisters that is not understood until another tragedy.
title: Ever made Promises you couldn't keep?

author: Alicia Crews
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2020
review_content: This is a book you won't be able to put down. Four gal friends sworn to each other......then one is found dead.Was it the husband? He appears the most likely to have done it. But not till the end will you really know. Lots of twists and turns with many possibilities. Keeps you guessing all the way.
title: Fabulous Read

author: M Daniels
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2020
review_content: The writing is fine. The plot well constructed. But it is not much of a mystery novel. Starts out as a procedure, but just as quickly turns to a melodrama. Fine if that is what you like, however I was anticipating something far different, hence the middle of the road  rating.
title: Not my cup of tea

author: C Doro
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2020
review_content: This book was a surprise in that the setting is the CT shoreline which is very familiar to me. It was interesting to recognize the towns, restaurants, streets, etc in this book.  I actually work on one of the streets mentioned!  The story and characters were great. Would make a good movie!
title: Delightful

author: Objectivity
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2020
review_content: Some may find this book depressing by the end (based on some of these reviews) but it really isn't.  I found it honest in depicting the fragile yet persevering strength of the human mind.  The book was riveting for a number of reasons:  The typical "who done it" perspective for one, the description of what affects us as humans socially (for good and for bad)  and the perseverance of the search for what love  the human spirit really are.  I enjoyed it very much.
title: Riveting and psychologically interesting!

author: Lisa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2020
review_content: The story and suspense held my attention.  I did not want to put the book down.  There were often times though I would jump pages because too much art detail in pages not relevant to the story.
title: Good story line

author: Shawn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2020
review_content: I think the writer did an excellent job of weaving all the relationships into a great story. The ending was a surprise and disappointment. Just as in life, things are not always what they appear to be and people can often disappoint. I would really like to visit Connecticut now!
title: Be careful pulling loose threads!

author: Ginger Russell
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2020
review_content: I am a long time fan of Luanne Rice, and this book didn't disappoint me in any way.  It is a murder mystery, but not the suspenseful kind.  It is more the psychology within the circle of family and friends involved.  I enjoyed the book and wasn't ready for it to end.
title: Love Luanne Rice!

author: Jennifer Jones
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2021
review_content: Who would have ever thought this story would end as it did! I read this as a read another before that had characters from this. I love all of her stories and it was great to be able to read back to an older one to get a “new” story but not be lost from the characters of a newer.
title: A wonderful read of love and love beyond loss!!

author: Alison
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2021
review_content: Two murders, 23 years apart, linked by family ties and a painting.I couldn't put this book down. I kept trying to figure out what happened, picking up and tossing out suspects. When the killer was revealed, I was gobsmacked. The ending was especially poignant.
title: Did not see that ending coming

author: Emily S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2020
review_content: A truly beautiful story and tribute to friendship!!! Complex characters with a riveting plot, this is not to be missed!!  Absolutely hooked from the first chapter!! Not quite sure how you get through the entire range of emotions involved with this story! A must read!!!
title: Stunning Read!!!

author: woodnknoll
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2020
review_content: I was pretty sure that the prime suspect was not the murderer because that's just the nature of murder mysteries. However, I also could not have predicted the person that was the murderer.  Even in hindsight I can't see how we were supposed to understand the motive or the clues that led us here. Maybe, I missed some important clues????
title: I didn't see the end coming...

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2020
review_content: I got this book as a free download , also I liked the author. The story had depth and got me involved since the beginning. Beth was murdered and her sister Kate must find out who did it. The story had some unexpected twists and the end was not as expected. Some questions remained unresolved for me at the end- maybe they were edited out.
title: Marti 's review

author: D Martin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2020
review_content: It is so enjoyable when I discover a book that I can't stop reading from the first page until the last!  The family and friendships surrounding Beth and Kate and the similarities between Beth's murder and that of their mother had me trying to solve who did it right up to the last chapter!  Luanne Rice is a great author and I am so glad I chose this book as my first read of the New Year!
title: Loved this book!

author: AMF
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2020
review_content: The story grabbed your attention early on, but soon too many hypothesis were thrown around.  It was difficult to imagine the story line developing the way it did.  People in control of destinies withour realizing it. The last 100 pages were simply too long playing out.
title: Perhaps a bit morbid

author: LilyBelle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2020
review_content: There was nothing worth caring about here. It all seemed trite and forced. I cut to the end just to learn who did it.  I have never done that before but life is too short to read books that don’t touch you in some way.
title: Couldn’t finish it...

author: Patricia J Farghaly
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2020
review_content: Ms Rice has done it again. A mystery murder . Wow. I finished this way to fast. Couldnt put it down. Still classic Ms Rice but with a twist.  More more more. Thank you Ms Rice for going out of your usual style but yet keeping it too. Fabulous. Keep them coming.
title: A MUST READ. A GREAT MURDER MYSTERY BASED IN CONNECTICUT TOO.

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2020
review_content: I enjoyed this book very much.  It kept me guessing the whole way through!!  Although these two sisters had gone through a traumatic experience when their mother died it seemed to be repeating itself.  The same detective who worked the first case worked hard to unravel this one!!
title: Great. Suspense

author: Linda H
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2020
review_content: I would have given a 5 since it was a really good storyline with strong characters. I gave a 4 for the use of the “f” work that really added nothing to the story and for a lot of us who are uncomfortable with that word detracted from the enjoyment of the book.
title: Great story line

author: Just Books
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2020
review_content: I couldn't get through this. Gave up a couple of chapters in. It's overwritten and boring. Dull characters as well.
title: Boring as can be

author: L. Schlesser
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2020
review_content: This book was one of the best murder mysteries I've read. About a woman who is murdered and all points lead to her husband but it's really not all that simple. A tangled web of who could have done it keeps you guessing. I will read more books by this author.
title: One of the Best Mysteries

author: Amanda S
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2020
review_content: I had read another one of Rice's books, The Edge of Winter, more than a decade ago. I enjoyed that book even despite it not really being in one of my go to genres. When I saw this pop up as a Kindle First Read I was excited to give it a chance. Overall it kept my attention very well. The author did a great job of setting up multiple suspects who all seem equally as likely to have done it.In short, was it my favorite book? No. Was it a well written mystery? Yes. Will I read it again? Probably not. Would I recommend it? Maybe yeah.
title: A good mystery at the very least

author: Liz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2020
review_content: The author kept my attention  through out the plot . Some of the emphasis on the art for me was hard to follow because I’m not knowledgeable in that venue. Well done in not knowing who committed the crime until the end.......main Characters were well developed
title: A good read

author: Mary Nelson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2020
review_content: I was eager to reach the end of the mystery, as several potential killers were investigated.  I felt that the end came from nowhere.  I found the end very unsatisfying.  I went back and could not find anything which would lead to explaining why the crime occurred.
title: The majority of the novel is satisfying.

author: Lauryn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2020
review_content: Wow! I am so moved by this book. It is more than just a story that unravels a crime in the elite art but it’s a novel that teaches the values of love, friendships and life. It’s above about letting go of the past and loved ones so that we can learn something about ourselves and forge through life stronger than we were the day before.Luanne Rice uses imagery of landscape to describe the characters inner dialogue; painting a beautiful picture for the reader to enjoy. This novel is a work of art itself. It will forever remain in my top favorites. Thank Luanne Rice for sharing this beautiful work of art with the world.
title: There is nothing not to like

author: Pam Stolzer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2020
review_content: Luanne Rice weaves a story that holds you until the end. Making you wonder who did it, the story wanders through the minds of each character yielding suspicion of all. Not until you finally know the perpetrator do you understand what and why it happened.
title: Great throughout!

author: Avid reader for many years
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2020
review_content: Poignant story of friendship, love, jealousy and betrayal.  If childhood friends, do we ever really move out of the roles self assigned at those young, malleable ages? Ms. Rice is truly an author a notch above.  Well written, intriguing, great mystery.
title: A Notch Above

author: Patricia Whittington
